Package FileManager

Interface dataReader

All Known Implementing Classes:
CsvFileReader
public interface dataReader
The dataReader interface defines methods for reading data from a CSV file. Implementations of this interface provide functionality to read the entire dataset, a specific row, or a specific column from a CSV file.

This interface can be implemented for reading CSV data from various sources or locations within a project.

Since:
2024-11-6
Version:
1.0
Author:
Tan Guang Wei

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    List<String[]>
    readColumn(String fileName, int column)
    Reads a specific column from the specified CSV file.
    List<String[]>
    readData(String fileName)
    Reads the entire contents of the specified CSV file.
    List<String[]>
    readRow(String fileName, int row)
    Reads a specific row from the specified CSV file.

  • Method Details

    • readData

      List<String[]> readData(String fileName)
      Reads the entire contents of the specified CSV file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the CSV file to read.
      Returns:
      A list of String arrays, where each array represents a line of data in the CSV file, split by commas. If the file is not found or an error occurs, an empty list is returned.

    • readRow

      List<String[]> readRow(String fileName, int row)
      Reads a specific row from the specified CSV file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the CSV file to read.
      row - The index of the row to read, where the first row is 0.
      Returns:
      A list containing a single String array that represents the requested row's data, split by commas. If the row is out of bounds, an empty list is returned.

    • readColumn

      List<String[]> readColumn(String fileName, int column)
      Reads a specific column from the specified CSV file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the CSV file to read.
      column - The index of the column to read, where the first column is 0.
      Returns:
      A list of String arrays, each containing a single element from the specified column of the CSV file. If the column index is out of bounds, an empty list is returned.
